triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: The core task that SV-COMP evaluates across multiple verification tools and specifications.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The mathematical foundation for verifying software meets specifications that the competition relies on.

triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: A key verification technique used by many of the tools evaluated in SV-COMP.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: One of the six key verification specifications (reachability) tested in the competition.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Two of the six verification specifications (memory safety and memory cleanup) are directly based on this concept.

triples.name: Data race
triples.relevance: One of the six verification specifications that the competition checks for in concurrent programs.

triples.name: Integer overflow
triples.relevance: The overflow specification tested in the verification track to detect arithmetic safety violations.

triples.name: Termination analysis
triples.relevance: One of the six verification specifications that checks whether programs terminate or loop infinitely.

triples.name: Exception handling
triples.relevance: Related to the runtime exception detection and assertion validity checking in Java verification tasks.

triples.name: C (programming language)
triples.relevance: Primary language for the verification benchmark with 33,353 verification tasks.

triples.name: Java (programming language)
triples.relevance: Secondary language tested with 674 verification tasks for assertion validity and 673 demo tasks.

triples.name: Benchmark (computing)
triples.relevance: SV-COMP proposes a comprehensive benchmark set of 33,353 C and 674 Java verification tasks for evaluating tools.
